SENT.plain: The case of a 30-year-old non-Marfan woman who developed a type III acute aortic dissection 5 days after delivery, followed within 16 h by an independent type II dissection, is reported
Preoperative CT scan imaging and TEE suggested metachronous type II and type III dissection
This was confirmed at surgery, where limited dissection of the aortic root without communication with the isthmic area via the aortic arch was evidenced
The patient underwent repair of the aortic root and adjacent ascending aorta and was medically treated for her type III dissection
This is the first report of metachronous acute aortic dissections in puerperium
